          Bio
          I just finished my PhD (woohoo!) at SUNY ESF where I
          studied a blend of statistics, GIS, and (a bit of) forest
          ecology. In broad academic terms I’d say this makes me a
          geographer, but practically speaking I spend most of my time
          doing spatial data science. My dissertation focused on methods
          for leveraging open data to produce maps and estimates of
          forest biomass and carbon at local scales relevant to
          management, with an additional emphasis on propagating
          uncertainty up from field measurements through modeling
          pipelines to eventual pixel predictions and area-level
          estimates. I have an extensive background in programming and
          computer science, and have learned to couple these skills with
          statistical inference and machine learning techniques to
          produce landscape-level insights. I enjoy the challenges that
          come with wrangling all kinds of spatial data using R and
          python.
          
          
          Education
          SUNY College of Environmental Science &
          Forestry | Syracuse, NY
          Ph.D. in Environmental Science | August 2019 - May 2024
          Tufts University | Medford, MA
          B.S. in Computer Science | August 2013 - May 2017
          
          
          Experience
          Research Assistant | SUNY ESF, CAFRI | August 2019 - May
          2024
          Data Engineer | Lightkeeper, LLC | August
          2017 - July 2019
